etymology.description: 创(創) (chuàng, "create") + 业(業) (yè, "business") + 公司(公司) (gōngsī, "company")
etymology.interpretation: A 创业公司(創業公司) (chuàngyè gōngsī, "startup") refers to a company that is in the process of being created and entering the business world. The combination emphasizes the creation (创/創) of a business (业/業) entity, which is encapsulated as a company (公司) designed to bring new ideas or products to market.

examples.chinese: 我在创业公司工作(我在創業公司工作)。
创业公司充满创意(創業公司充滿創意)，吸引了许多年轻人(吸引了許多年輕人)。
examples.pinyin: Chuàngyè gōngsī chōngmǎn chuàngyì, xīyǐnle xǔduō niánqīngrén.
examples.english: Startups are full of creativity and attract many young people.

examples.chinese: 创业公司往往冒险尝试新方法(創業公司往往冒險嘗試新方法)，市场竞争激烈(市場競爭激烈)。
examples.pinyin: Chuàngyè gōngsī wǎngwǎng màoxiǎn chángshì xīn fāngfǎ, shìchǎng jìngzhēng jīliè.
examples.english: Startups often take risks to try new methods, and market competition is fierce.
